identificationModule.briefTitle: Multi-modality MRI Study on Effect to Collateral Circulation and Blood Perfusion of Acute Cerebral Infarction by Human Urinary Kallidinogenase

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Human urinary kallidinogenase can promote the establishment of collateral circulation in the ischemic penumbra due to the stenosis or occlusion of middle cerebral artery and then increase the perfusion.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Patients with acute ischemic stroke will be given human urinary kallidinogenase .Then we will estimate the cerebral collateral circulation in ischemic regions and final infarct volume, comparing with traditional therapy such as Shuxuening injection, which will provide new evidence for the treatment of ischemic stroke. Perfusion Weighted Imaging(PWI) could be a method to reflect the infarction center and low perfusion of tissue.

armGroups.label: Human urinary kallidinogenase and Shuxuening injection
armGroups.description: Human urinary kallidinogenase 0.15PNA and Shuxuening injection 20mg, every day for 7 days.

interventions.name: Human Urinary Kallidinogenase
armGroupLabels: Human urinary kallidinogenase and Shuxuening injection

interventions.name: Shuxuening injection
armGroupLabels: Human urinary kallidinogenase and Shuxuening injection

primaryOutcomes.description: Reflect the infarction center and low perfusion of tissue

locations.facility: Department of Neurolgy,Xuanwu Hospital of Capital Medical University
